body: You’re welcome to figure out what flags are required, but in general we’re not likely to want to gate features. SRTP might be an exception, but we’d have to modify pyopenssl (I’m assuming that’s what uses it) to handle its absence.

Hi Paul,

To provide a bit of context and clarification:

This is a specific case of the issue we talked about last year at PyCon, where the backend fails to load if certain bindings are missing from the OpenSSL ABI. In contrast, there are some bindings, such as RSA-OAEP with SHA2 hashes, that [in the absence of bindings] only fail when you try to use them rather than when you try to load the backend. Our end-goal here is for pyca/cryptography to exhibit this later behavior for any features that can be disabled in the standard OpenSSL build.

We realize that this is probably a bit of a niche use case, as I assume that the majority of pyca/cryptography users just use the wheels and their included binaries, but this is a use case that we need to support and we would like to work with you all to get pyca/cryptography to a point where it does.

We don't have a timeline on when we'll be able to start digging into this, but we wanted to get the conversation started to begin scoping the level of effort needed to address this as well as to start enumerating what changes will need to be made where.

Ah, gotcha. I'm in favor of making us more robust where possible (and with the caveat that we need to make it testable to prevent regressions...without blowing up our test matrix). I look forward to seeing what your team makes of it :)

issue.title: Fails to build when OpenSSL is build without Certificate Transparency (CT) support

repository.name: cryptography
repository.description: cryptography is a package designed to expose cryptographic primitives and recipes to Python developers.

issue.body:
cryptography fails to build with compiler errors when compiled against an OpenSSL that has Certificate Transparency (CT) disabled.

Build warnings/error summary:
 * Several: `error: use of undeclared identifier  'SCT_*'`
 * Several: `error: use of undeclared identifier 'CT_LOG_*'`
 * Several: `warning: implicit declaration of function 'SCT_*' is invalid in C99`
 * Final error:

```
build/temp.freebsd-13.0-CURRENT-amd64-3.7/_openssl.c:33416:8: error: unknown type name 'ct_log_entry_type_t'
static ct_log_entry_type_t _cffi_d_SCT_get_log_entry_type(SCT const * x0)
       ^
```

Reproduction Environment:

 * Operating System: FreeBSD 13.0-CURRENT #3 r354143 (amd64)
   * FreeBSD clang version 9.0.0 (tags/RELEASE_900/final 372316) (based on LLVM 9.0.0)
 * OpenSSL: 1.1.1d-freebsd 10 Sep 2019 (via ports, with `CT` option **disabled**) 
   * `./configure: --openssldir=/usr/local/openssl  --prefix=/usr/local no-ct `
 * Python 2.7.17 / 3.7.5
 * cryptography: 2.8 (PyPI sdist)

Full build log attached:

[cryptography-2.8-no-CT-build-failure.log](https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/files/3855123/cryptography-2.8-no-CT-build-failure.log)

body: `OPENSSL_NO_CT` is another flag we may want to consider. (ported that from #5067)

So, I've worked out a couple of things going on here (I'm from Matt's team).

One, setting `-DOPENSSL_NO_SRTP` as a Configure argument is an anti-pattern. OpenSSL treats this as something similar to `CFLAGS` you would set to control optimization - notably, it does not cause `#define OPENSSL_NO_SRTP` to show up in `<openssl/opensslconf.h>`, so there's no way for a consuming package to detect at compilation time that SRTP related symbols don't exist, and you're stuck detecting it at (dynamic) link time. `no-srtp` is the correct replacement, and does the right thing. We actually had a number of these options set internally; migrating them to the `no-*` variants fixed all of our missing symbol errors except those related to SRTP.

Two, `no-srtp` just needed some pretty straightforward work in the relevant FFI source's `CUSTOMIZATIONS` block and in `cryptography.hazmat.bindings.openssl._conditional`. I'm sending a PR for this shortly.

On the no-ct issue (#5067) I suspect it's probably just missing a check for `OPENSSL_NO_CT` [here](https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/blob/master/src/_cffi_src/openssl/ct.py#L68). I don't have much experience running with this configuration, personally, but `<openssl/ct.h>` basically guards its entire contents on it, so I imagine that's the problem.

issue.title: fixes #5113 - Making some SRTP related symbols conditional on OPENSSL_NO_SRTP

repository.name: cryptography
repository.description: cryptography is a package designed to expose cryptographic primitives and recipes to Python developers.

issue.body: Fixes #5113. I admit to being a little out of my depth on helping with the testing infrastructure - are the changes in #4763 similar enough to use as a starting point?
